summary.long: Zephaniah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came to Zephaniah son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah, during the reign of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will sweep away everything
    from the face of the earth,”
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will sweep away both man and beast;
    I will sweep away the birds in the sky
    and the fish in the sea—
    and the idols that cause the wicked to stumble.”
“When I destroy all mankind
    on the face of the earth,”
declares the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will stretch out my hand against Judah
    and against all who live in Jerusalem.
I will destroy every remnant of Baal worship in this place,
    the very names of the idolatrous priests—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those who bow down on the roofs
    to worship the starry host,
those who bow down and swear by the Lord
    and who also swear by Molek,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those who turn back from following the Lord
    and neither seek the Lord nor inquire of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be silent before the Sovereign Lord,
    for the day of the Lord is near.
The Lord has prepared a sacrifice;
    he has consecrated those he has invited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“On the day of the Lord’s sacrifice
    I will punish the officials
    and the king’s sons
and all those clad
    in foreign clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On that day I will punish
    all who avoid stepping on the threshold,
who fill the temple of their gods
    with violence and deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“On that day,”
    declares the Lord,
“a cry will go up from the Fish Gate,
    wailing from the New Quarter,
    and a loud crash from the hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
At that time I will search Jerusalem with lamps
    and punish those who are complacent,
    who are like wine left on its dregs,
who think, ‘The Lord will do nothing,
    either good or bad.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their wealth will be plundered,
    their houses demolished.
Though they build houses,
    they will not live in them;
though they plant vineyards,
    they will not drink the wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The great day of the Lord is near—
    near and coming quickly.
The cry on the day of the Lord is bitter;
    the Mighty Warrior shouts his battle cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That day will be a day of wrath—
    a day of distress and anguish,
        a day of trouble and ruin,
    a day of darkness and gloom,
        a day of clouds and blackness—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a day of trumpet and battle cry
against the fortified cities
    and against the corner towers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will bring such distress on all people
    that they will grope about like those who are blind,
    because they have sinned against the Lord.
Their blood will be poured out like dust
    and their entrails like dung.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Neither their silver nor their gold
    will be able to save them
    on the day of the Lord’s wrath.”
In the fire of his jealousy
    the whole earth will be consumed,
for he will make a sudden end
    of all who live on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gather together, gather yourselves together,
    you shameful nation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
before the decree takes effect
    and that day passes like windblown chaff,
before the Lord’s fierce anger
    comes upon you,
before the day of the Lord’s wrath
    comes upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seek the Lord, all you humble of the land,
    you who do what he commands.
Seek righteousness, seek humility;
    perhaps you will be sheltered
    on the day of the Lord’s anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gaza will be abandoned
    and Ashkelon left in ruins.
At midday Ashdod will be emptied
    and Ekron uprooted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you who live by the sea,
    you Kerethite people;
the word of the Lord is against you,
    Canaan, land of the Philistines.
He says, “I will destroy you,
    and none will be left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The land by the sea will become pastures
    having wells for shepherds
    and pens for flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That land will belong
    to the remnant of the people of Judah;
    there they will find pasture.
In the evening they will lie down
    in the houses of Ashkelon.
The Lord their God will care for them;
    he will restore their fortunes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have heard the insults of Moab
    and the taunts of the Ammonites,
who insulted my people
    and made threats against their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, as surely as I live,”
    declares the Lord Almighty,
    the God of Israel,
“surely Moab will become like Sodom,
    the Ammonites like Gomorrah—
a place of weeds and salt pits,
    a wasteland forever.
The remnant of my people will plunder them;
    the survivors of my nation will inherit their land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what they will get in return for their pride,
    for insulting and mocking
    the people of the Lord Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will be awesome to them
    when he destroys all the gods of the earth.
Distant nations will bow down to him,
    all of them in their own lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You Cushites, too,
    will be slain by my sword.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will stretch out his hand against the north
    and destroy Assyria,
leaving Nineveh utterly desolate
    and dry as the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Flocks and herds will lie down there,
    creatures of every kind.
The desert owl and the screech owl
    will roost on her columns.
Their hooting will echo through the windows,
    rubble will fill the doorways,
    the beams of cedar will be exposed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the city of revelry
    that lived in safety.
She said to herself,
    “I am the one! And there is none besides me.”
What a ruin she has become,
    a lair for wild beasts!
All who pass by her scoff
    and shake their fists.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to the city of oppressors,
    rebellious and defiled!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She obeys no one,
    she accepts no correction.
She does not trust in the Lord,
    she does not draw near to her God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her officials within her
    are roaring lions;
her rulers are evening wolves,
    who leave nothing for the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her prophets are unprincipled;
    they are treacherous people.
Her priests profane the sanctuary
    and do violence to the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord within her is righteous;
    he does no wrong.
Morning by morning he dispenses his justice,
    and every new day he does not fail,
    yet the unrighteous know no shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Of Jerusalem I thought,
    ‘Surely you will fear me
    and accept correction!’
Then her place of refuge would not be destroyed,
    nor all my punishments come upon her.
But they were still eager
    to act corruptly in all they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore wait for me,”
    declares the Lord,
    “for the day I will stand up to testify.
I have decided to assemble the nations,
    to gather the kingdoms
and to pour out my wrath on them—
    all my fierce anger.
The whole world will be consumed
    by the fire of my jealous anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then I will purify the lips of the peoples,
    that all of them may call on the name of the Lord
    and serve him shoulder to shoulder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From beyond the rivers of Cush
    my worshipers, my scattered people,
    will bring me offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On that day you, Jerusalem, will not be put to shame
    for all the wrongs you have done to me,
because I will remove from you
    your arrogant boasters.
Never again will you be haughty
    on my holy hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I will leave within you
    the meek and humble.
The remnant of Israel
    will trust in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will do no wrong;
    they will tell no lies.
A deceitful tongue
    will not be found in their mouths.
They will eat and lie down
    and no one will make them afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing, Daughter Zion;
    shout aloud, Israel!
Be glad and rejoice with all your heart,
    Daughter Jerusalem!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has taken away your punishment,
    he has turned back your enemy.
The Lord, the King of Israel, is with you;
    never again will you fear any harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On that day
    they will say to Jerusalem,
“Do not fear, Zion;
    do not let your hands hang limp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord your God is with you,
    the Mighty Warrior who saves.
He will take great delight in you;
    in his love he will no longer rebuke you,
    but will rejoice over you with singing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will remove from you
    all who mourn over the loss of your appointed festivals,
    which is a burden and reproach for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time I will deal
    with all who oppressed you.
I will rescue the lame;
    I will gather the exiles.
I will give them praise and honor
    in every land where they have suffered shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time I will gather you;
    at that time I will bring you home.
I will give you honor and praise
    among all the peoples of the earth
when I restore your fortunes
    before your very eyes,”
says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
